Brine dragons are usually blue-green in color, with shiny scales, crests that help them glide through the water, and sweeping neck frills. They care little for either good or evil. As they are both opinionated and willing to impose their sense of order on others, many brine dragons eventually seek to rule over a meticulously crafted community. These communities are orderly and well-planned, with rigid standards of courtesy and unchanging laws set down by the dragon themself. A settlement seeded by a brine dragon can be made of members of almost any ancestry, but the most common inhabitants are humans, merfolk, tengus, or sahuagin. Depending on the dragon's personality, their community members might view their brine dragon ruler as anything from a benevolent force of order to a fearful tyrant. Regardless, the typical brine dragon has little patience for kindness or philanthropy, and the strength and health of their settlement as a whole are of greater concern than individuals' well-being. A notable exception to this dispassion rises when an outside force encroaches on their lands. In these cases, the brine dragon is quick to step in and aid in the defense of their community. Although brine dragons enjoy cultivating settlements, they rarely make their lairs within the city limits, instead preferring to dwell in sea caves or cliffside grottoes overlooking the coastline. Here they can retreat for privacy as needed, or can accumulate and display their gathered wealth in a place where they feel safe spreading out their treasures. Brine dragon hoards often consist of a mix of offerings and taxes paid by those they rule over and strange discoveries salvaged from sunken ships. **[Recall Knowledge - Dragon](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=2)): DC 41 **[Recall Knowledge - Elemental](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=2), [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10)): DC 41 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 39 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 36 [Ancient Brine Dragon](/Monsters.aspx?ID=623) **Source** [Bestiary 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=32) pg. 88 2.0 **Perception** +32; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12), [scent (imprecise) 60 feet](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=33) **Languages** [Aquan](/Languages.aspx?ID=14), [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Draconic](/Languages.aspx?ID=2), [Sylvan](/Languages.aspx?ID=10), [Utopian](/Languages.aspx?ID=36) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +28, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +32, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) +32, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +34, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10) +30, [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14) +30, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16) +29 **Str** +9 **Dex** +5 **Con** +6 **Int** +5 **Wis** +5 **Cha** +6 --- **AC** 40 **Fort** +31 **Ref** +30 **Will** +30 +1 status to all saves vs. magic **HP** 330 **Immunities** acid, [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=28), [sleep](/Traits.aspx?ID=145) **[Frightful Presence](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=17)** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=206), [emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60), [fear](/Traits.aspx?ID=68), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106)) 90 feet, DC 36
**Brine Spit** **Trigger** A creature the brine dragon observes within 30 feet uses a [concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32) action; **Effect** The dragon spits a glob of caustic salt water at the creature. The creature takes 7d6 acid damage (DC 36 basic Reflex save). On a failure, the concentrate action is disrupted. --- **Speed** 50 feet, fly 140 feet, swim 70 feet **Melee** jaws +34 ([Acid](/Traits.aspx?ID=3), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 20 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 3d10+17 piercing plus 5d4 acid **Melee** claw +34 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 15 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 3d10+17 slashing **Melee** tail +32 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 25 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 3d12+17 bludgeoning **Melee** wing +32 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 20 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 2d12+17 piercing **Primal Innate Spells** DC 38, attack +30 - **4th** [Hydraulic Push](/Spells.aspx?ID=154) (at will), [Obscuring Mist](/Spells.aspx?ID=210) (at will) - **5th** [Control Water](/Spells.aspx?ID=51) (×3), [Mariner's Curse](/Spells.aspx?ID=184) - **6th** [Hydraulic Torrent](/Spells.aspx?ID=155) **Breath Weapon** ([Acid](/Traits.aspx?ID=3), [Evocation](/Traits.aspx?ID=65), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) The dragon breathes a spray of acidic salt water that deals 18d6 acid damage in a 120-foot line (DC 38 basic Reflex save). They can't use Breath Weapon again for 1d4 rounds. **Capsize** ([Attack](/Traits.aspx?ID=15)) The dragon tries to capsize an adjacent aquatic vessel of their size or smaller. They must succeed at an [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) check with a DC of 35 (reduced by 5 for each size smaller the vessel is than the dragon) or the pilot's [Sailing Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8) DC, whichever is higher. **Desiccating Bite** The dragon makes a jaws Strike. On a hit, the target takes 6d6 [persistent acid damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29), and is [sickened 3](/Conditions.aspx?ID=34) from the pain of salt and brine in its wounds. **Draconic Frenzy** The dragon makes two claw Strikes and one wing Strike in any order. **Draconic Momentum** The dragon recharges their Breath Weapon whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike. **Painful Strikes** ([Acid](/Traits.aspx?ID=3)) The brine dragon's body is encrusted with salty, acidic crystals. When a target takes damage from one of the dragon's melee Strikes, it must succeed at a DC 38 Fortitude Save or be [stunned 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=36) (stunned 3 on a critical failure). The target then becomes temporarily immune for 1 minute.
